item.title: Valuation Methods
item.author: cai-joseph@outlook.com (Joseph Cai)
item.description:
The financial term ‘No-arbitrage’ is also a pricing approach, upon which Black-Scholes-Merton (BSM) model was developed. It assumes that there are no risk-free profit opportunities in the market.

In the realm of asset valuation, several primary approaches and methodologies are employed to determine an asset’s fair value.

item.title: What Is A Deal Structure
item.author: cai-joseph@outlook.com (Joseph Cai)
item.description:
Introduction
#

Deal-structuring process begins with addressing a set of key questions that help define initial negotiating positions, potential risks, options for managing risk, levels of tolerance for risk, and conditions under which the buyer or seller will “walk away” from the negotiations.
